t: John 18
Betrayal and Arrest in Gethsemane
When*p Jesus had spoken these words, He went out with His disciples over the Brook Kidron, where there was a garden, which He and His disciples entered.
And Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place; for Jesus often met there with His disciples.
Then Judas, having received a detachment of*i troops,*i and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
Jesus therefore, knowing all things that would come upon Him, went forward and said to them, “Whom*r are*r you*r seeking?”*r
They*p answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus*p said to them, “I*r am*r He.”*ir And Judas, who betrayed Him, also stood with them.
Now when He said to them, “I*r am*r He,”*ir they drew back and fell to the ground.
Then*p He asked them again, “Whom*r are*r you*r seeking?”*r And*p they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
Jesus*p answered, “I*r have*r told*r you*r that*r I*r am*r He.*ir Therefore,*r if*r you*r seek*r Me,*r let*r these*r go*r their*r way,”*r
that the saying might be fulfilled which He spoke, “Of*r those*r whom*r You*r gave*r Me*r I*r have*r lost*r none.”*r
Then*p Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
So*p Jesus said to Peter, “Put*r your*r sword*r into*r the*r sheath.*r Shall*r I*r not*r drink*r the*r cup*r which*r My*r Father*r has*r given*r Me?”*r
Before the High Priest
Then*p the detachment of*i troops*i and the captain and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him.
And they led Him away to Annas first, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas who was high priest that year.
Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
Peter Denies Jesus
And*p Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did*i another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.
But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought Peter in.
Then the servant girl who kept the door said to Peter, “You are not also one*i of this Man’s disciples, are you?” He*p said, “I am not.”
Now*p the servants and officers who had made a fire of coals stood there, for it was cold, and they warmed themselves. And Peter stood with them and warmed himself.
Jesus Questioned by the High Priest
The*p high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and His doctrine.

Jesus*p answered him, “I*r spoke*r openly*r to*r the*r world.*r I*r always*r taught*r in*r synagogues*r and*r in*r the*r temple,*r where*r the*r Jews*r always*r meet,*r and*r in*r secret*r I*r have*r said*r nothing.*r
Why*r do*r you*r ask*r Me?*r Ask*r those*r who*r have*r heard*r Me*r what*r I*r said*r to*r them.*r Indeed*r they*r know*r what*r I*r said.”*r
And*p when He had said these things, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, “Do You answer the high priest like that?”
Jesus*p answered him, “If*r I*r have*r spoken*r evil,*r bear*r witness*r of*r the*r evil;*r but*r if*r well,*r why*r do*r you*r strike*r Me?”*r
Then*p Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
Peter Denies Twice More
Now*p Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. Therefore they said to him, “You are not also one*i of His disciples, are you?” He*p denied it*i and said, “I am not!”
One*p of the servants of the high priest, a relative of*i him*i whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
Peter then denied again; and immediately a rooster crowed.
In Pilate’s Court
Then*p they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium, and it was early morning. But they themselves did not go into the Praetorium, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover.
Pilate then went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this Man?”
They*p answered and said to him, “If He were not an evildoer, we would not have delivered Him up to you.”
Then*p Pilate said to them, “You take Him and judge Him according to your law.” Therefore*p the Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”
that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled which He spoke, signifying by what death He would die.
Then*p Pilate entered the Praetorium again, called Jesus, and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
Jesus*p answered him, “Are*r you*r speaking*r for*r yourself*r about*r this,*r or*r did*r others*r tell*r you*r this*r concerning*r Me?”*r
Pilate*p answered, “Am I a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests have delivered You to me. What have You done?”

Jesus*p answered, “My*r kingdom*r is*r not*r of*r this*r world.*r If*r My*r kingdom*r were*r of*r this*r world,*r My*r servants*r would*r fight,*r so*r that*r I*r should*r not*r be*r delivered*r to*r the*r Jews;*r but*r now*r My*r kingdom*r is*r not*r from*r here.”*r

Pilate*p therefore said to Him, “Are You a king then?” Jesus*p answered, “You*r say*r rightly*ir that*r I*r am*r a*r king.*r For*r this*r cause*r I*r was*r born,*r and*r for*r this*r cause*r I*r have*r come*r into*r the*r world,*r that*r I*r should*r bear*r witness*r to*r the*r truth.*r Everyone*r who*r is*r of*r the*r truth*r hears*r My*r voice.”*r
Pilate*p said to Him, “What is truth?” And when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, “I find no fault in Him at all.
Taking the Place of Barabbas
“But*p you have a custom that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Do you therefore want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
Then*p they all cried again, saying, “Not this Man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
